channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Neural Stein critics with staged $L^2$-regularization
item.description: Theoretically, we relate the training dynamic with large regularization weight to the kernel regression optimization of "lazy training" regime in early training times.

item.title: Pre-training helps Bayesian optimization too
item.description: Contrary to a common belief that BO is suited to optimizing black-box functions, it actually requires domain knowledge on characteristics of those functions to deploy BO successfully.

item.title: Masked Surfel Prediction for Self-Supervised Point Cloud Learning
item.description: In this work, we make the first attempt, to the best of our knowledge, to consider the local geometry information explicitly into the masked auto-encoding, and propose a novel Masked Surfel Prediction (MaskSurf) method.

item.title: Leveraging Log Instructions in Log-based Anomaly Detection
item.description: Artificial Intelligence for IT Operations (AIOps) describes the process of maintaining and operating large IT systems using diverse AI-enabled methods and tools for, e. g., anomaly detection and root cause analysis, to support the remediation, optimization, and automatic initiation of self-stabilizing IT activities.

item.title: Do We Really Need Inertia?
item.description: The emphasis on inertia for system stability has been a long-held tradition in conventional grids.

item.title: ExpansionNet: exploring the sequence length bottleneck in the Transformer for Image Captioning
item.description: Most recent state of art architectures rely on combinations and variations of three approaches: convolutional, recurrent and self-attentive methods.

item.title: For Learning in Symmetric Teams, Local Optima are Global Nash Equilibria
item.description: In this work, we show that any locally optimal symmetric strategy profile is also a (global) Nash equilibrium.

item.title: Contrastive Learning from Spatio-Temporal Mixed Skeleton Sequences for Self-Supervised Skeleton-Based Action Recognition
item.description: First, SkeleMix utilizes the topological information of skeleton data to mix two skeleton sequences by randomly combing the cropped skeleton fragments (the trimmed view) with the remaining skeleton sequences (the truncated view).

item.title: The DynaSig-ML Python package: automated learning of biomolecular dynamics-function relationships
item.description: Summary: The DynaSig-ML (Dynamical Signatures - Machine Learning) Python package allows the efficient, user-friendly exploration of 3D dynamics-function relationships in biomolecules, using datasets of experimental measures from large numbers of sequence variants.

item.title: Towards the Practical Utility of Federated Learning in the Medical Domain
item.description: Federated learning (FL) is an active area of research.

item.title: VeriDark: A Large-Scale Benchmark for Authorship Verification on the Dark Web
item.description: The DarkWeb represents a hotbed for illicit activity, where users communicate on different market forums in order to exchange goods and services.

item.title: Bridging the Gap between Object and Image-level Representations for Open-Vocabulary Detection
item.description: Two popular forms of weak-supervision used in open-vocabulary detection (OVD) include pretrained CLIP model and image-level supervision.

item.title: Training Transformers Together
item.description: The infrastructure necessary for training state-of-the-art models is becoming overly expensive, which makes training such models affordable only to large corporations and institutions.

item.title: Calibrate to Interpret
item.description: In this paper we show a first link between uncertainty and explainability, by studying the relation between calibration and interpretation.

item.title: SC2EGSet: StarCraft II Esport Replay and Game-state Dataset
item.description: Based on initial investigation of available StarCraft II datasets, we observed that our dataset is the largest publicly available source of StarCraft II esports data upon its publication.

item.title: Learning to restore images degraded by atmospheric turbulence using uncertainty
item.description: Atmospheric turbulence can significantly degrade the quality of images acquired by long-range imaging systems by causing spatially and temporally random fluctuations in the index of refraction of the atmosphere.

item.title: MCTS with Refinement for Proposals Selection Games in Scene Understanding
item.description: We also introduce a novel differentiable method for rendering the polygonal shapes of these proposals.

item.title: Equivariant Representation Learning via Class-Pose Decomposition
item.description: We introduce a general method for learning representations that are equivariant to symmetries of data.

item.title: Revisiting Pretraining Objectives for Tabular Deep Learning
item.description: Recent deep learning models for tabular data currently compete with the traditional ML models based on decision trees (GBDT).

item.title: Deep Rotation Correction without Angle Prior
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new and practical task, named Rotation Correction, to automatically correct the tilt with high content fidelity in the condition that the rotated angle is unknown.

item.title: TFCNs: A CNN-Transformer Hybrid Network for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Medical image segmentation is one of the most fundamental tasks concerning medical information analysis.

item.title: Evolution of Popularity Bias: Empirical Study and Debiasing
item.description: and how to debias in this long-term dynamic process?

item.title: Robust optimal well control using an adaptive multi-grid reinforcement learning framework
item.description: RL control policies are initially learned using computationally efficient low fidelity simulations using coarse grid discretization of the underlying partial differential equations (PDEs).

item.title: Inferring Structural Parameters of Low-Surface-Brightness-Galaxies with Uncertainty Quantification using Bayesian Neural Networks
item.description: Measuring the structural parameters (size, total brightness, light concentration, etc.)

item.title: Stochastic optimal well control in subsurface reservoirs using reinforcement learning
item.description: For this problem, the system is partially observed since the data is only available at well locations.

item.title: Dual-Stream Transformer for Generic Event Boundary Captioning
item.description: This paper describes our champion solution for the CVPR2022 Generic Event Boundary Captioning (GEBC) competition.

item.title: Back to the Basics: Revisiting Out-of-Distribution Detection Baselines
item.description: We study simple methods for out-of-distribution (OOD) image detection that are compatible with any already trained classifier, relying on only its predictions or learned representations.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Synthetic Educational Data Generation
item.description: Institutions collect massive learning traces but they may not disclose it for privacy issues.

item.title: A unified interpretable intelligent learning diagnosis framework for smart education
item.description: Intelligent learning diagnosis is a critical engine of smart education, which aims to estimate learners' current knowledge mastery status and predict their future learning performance.

item.title: Deformer: Towards Displacement Field Learning for Unsupervised Medical Image Registration
item.description: In this study, we propose a novel Deformer module along with a multi-scale framework for the deformable image registration task.

item.title: An Additive Instance-Wise Approach to Multi-class Model Interpretation
item.description: Interpretable machine learning offers insights into what factors drive a certain prediction of a black-box system and whether to trust it for high-stakes decisions or large-scale deployment.

item.title: On the instrumental variable estimation with many weak and invalid instruments
item.description: We discuss the fundamental issue of identification in linear instrumental variable (IV) models with unknown IV validity.

item.title: A Large Scale Search Dataset for Unbiased Learning to Rank
item.description: The unbiased learning to rank (ULTR) problem has been greatly advanced by recent deep learning techniques and well-designed debias algorithms.

item.title: D2HNet: Joint Denoising and Deblurring with Hierarchical Network for Robust Night Image Restoration
item.description: Night imaging with modern smartphone cameras is troublesome due to low photon count and unavoidable noise in the imaging system.

item.title: Dual Stream Computer-Generated Image Detection Network Based On Channel Joint And Softpool
item.description: The proposed network architecture includes a residual module for extracting image noise information and a joint channel information extraction module for capturing the shallow semantic information of image.

item.title: Bayesian Modeling of Language-Evoked Event-Related Potentials
item.description: Bayesian hierarchical models are well-suited to analyzing the often noisy data from electroencephalography experiments in cognitive neuroscience: these models provide an intuitive framework to account for structures and correlations in the data, and they allow a straightforward handling of uncertainty.

item.title: Compositional Generalization in Grounded Language Learning via Induced Model Sparsity
item.description: We provide a study of how induced model sparsity can help achieve compositional generalization and better sample efficiency in grounded language learning problems.

item.title: Light-weight spatio-temporal graphs for segmentation and ejection fraction prediction in cardiac ultrasound
item.description: In particular, segmentations of the left ventricle can be used to derive ventricular volume, ejection fraction (EF) and other relevant measurements.

item.title: Unsupervised Manifold Alignment with Joint Multidimensional Scaling
item.description: Our approach integrates Multidimensional Scaling (MDS) and Wasserstein Procrustes analysis into a joint optimization problem to simultaneously generate isometric embeddings of data and learn correspondences between instances from two different datasets, while only requiring intra-dataset pairwise dissimilarities as input.

item.title: Don't Pay Attention to the Noise: Learning Self-supervised Representations of Light Curves with a Denoising Time Series Transformer
item.description: Astrophysical light curves are particularly challenging data objects due to the intensity and variety of noise contaminating them.

item.title: A Learning System for Motion Planning of Free-Float Dual-Arm Space Manipulator towards Non-Cooperative Object
item.description: Module I realizes the multi-target trajectory planning for two end-effectors within a large target space.

item.title: GAMa: Cross-view Video Geo-localization
item.description: There are no existing datasets for this problem, therefore we propose GAMa dataset, a large-scale dataset with ground videos and corresponding aerial images.

item.title: GFNet: Geometric Flow Network for 3D Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation
item.description: However, recent projection-based methods for point cloud semantic segmentation usually utilize a vanilla late fusion strategy for the predictions of different views, failing to explore the complementary information from a geometric perspective during the representation learning.

item.title: Domain Adaptive Video Segmentation via Temporal Pseudo Supervision
item.description: Specifically, we design cross-frame pseudo labelling to provide pseudo supervision from previous video frames while learning from the augmented current video frames.

item.title: Histopathology DatasetGAN: Synthesizing Large-Resolution Histopathology Datasets
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) methods are enabling an increasing number of deep learning models to be trained on image datasets in domains where labels are difficult to obtain.

item.title: Local Relighting of Real Scenes
item.description: We introduce the task of local relighting, which changes a photograph of a scene by switching on and off the light sources that are visible within the image.

item.title: DCT-Net: Domain-Calibrated Translation for Portrait Stylization
item.description: This paper introduces DCT-Net, a novel image translation architecture for few-shot portrait stylization.

item.title: Tractable Dendritic RNNs for Reconstructing Nonlinear Dynamical Systems
item.description: In many scientific disciplines, we are interested in inferring the nonlinear dynamical system underlying a set of observed time series, a challenging task in the face of chaotic behavior and noise.

item.title: Strong Heuristics for Named Entity Linking
item.description: Named entity linking (NEL) in news is a challenging endeavour due to the frequency of unseen and emerging entities, which necessitates the use of unsupervised or zero-shot methods.

item.title: Pure Transformers are Powerful Graph Learners
item.description: We show that standard Transformers without graph-specific modifications can lead to promising results in graph learning both in theory and practice.
